alert.note: Alert for Itawamba; Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 24 at 10:58PM CDT until March 24 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...TORNADO EMERGENCY FOR AMORY AND SMITHVILLE IN MISSISSIPPI... ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN ITAWAMBA AND NORTHERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 1057 PM CDT, a confirmed large and destructive tornado was located near Amory, moving northeast at 65 mph. TORNADO EMERGENCY for Amory and Smithville. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Deadly tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. Locations impacted include... Amory, Smithville, New Wren, New Salem, Nettleton, Hatley, Sipsey Fork, Becker, Quincy, Turon, Splunge, Wren, Bigbee, Parham and Cadamy. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous, and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If in a mobile home, a vehicle or outdoors, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
